chat.title: Feedback for HFrEF admission
chat.message:
My recommendations are as follows:

Patient care

* Oxygen: change oxygen therapy to the standard of “oxygen therapy as needed to target SpO2 of >=92% (or 88-92%)”

* Intake and output: this should be measured at least at the same frequency of the vitals to allow for furosemide titration

* Telemetry should be an option (I realize this is not available at all sites)

* Heart failure education: do we have an appropriate handout for this? It would not be the cardiac rehab one.




Medications:

If possible, please separate this into two sections: section 1 - diuresis, section 2 - goal directed medical therapy. 

Under section 1 - Diuresis:

-Note: Volume overload requires diuresis to target an average weight loss / fluid deficit of 1kg/1L per day. If on home furosemide, start with double their home dose.

-furosemide: you should have a general option here in addition to pre-filled targets. Include daily, BID, and TID frequencies. IV and PO routes. 

-metolazone should be under this section as well




Section 2 - Goal directed medical therapy:

-Note: GDMT is to introduce all 4 pillars of therapy (ARNI/ACEi/ARB, BB, MRA, SGLT2i) within the first 4 weeks and to reach optimal doses within 3 months. 

-missing dapagliflozin 10 mg PO (unsure if pharmacare covers empagliflozin). Avoid starting if eGFR <25 (may continue if already on dapagliflozin)

-remove the “class II-IIIa symptoms” from the spironolactone tip

-consider moving both the nitrate+hydralazine combo to renal dysfunction section as these are used in lieu of ACE/ARB/ARNI




Laboratory:

-Unclear why there are two entries for BNP

-add a note “BNP or NT-proBNP should not be used to guide medical management of acute heart failure exacerbation. Use volume assessments to guide diuresis.”
